abstract: Figures reported this week showed that industrial production in the euro zone fell 2.5 percent in September from the prior month, the largest monthly decline since January 2009. Production in Germany was off 2.1 percent.
snippet: Figures reported this week showed that industrial production in the euro zone fell 2.5 percent in September from the prior month, the largest monthly decline since January 2009. Production in Germany was off 2.1 percent.
lead_paragraph: INDUSTRIAL production has been stagnating in many advanced economies around the world and is beginning to damage the German economy, which has been the strongest in the troubled euro zone.

headline.main: Production Sags, and Even Germany Is Affected
headline.print_headline: Sagging Production Is Affecting Even Germany
